episodes.title: Rabbit Every Monday/A Mouse Divided/Tree For Two
episodes.plot: Bugs introduces many of his co-hosts individually: Pepe Le Pew, Yosemite Sam, Tweety, Sylvester and Speedy Gonzales. But Daffy Duck can't convince Bugs to introduce him as well, try as he might during the show.

episodes.title: Putty Tat Trouble/Wise Quackers/Speedy Gonzales
episodes.plot: Rocky and Mugsy try to grab up some of the money from the sponsors of the show by going into the television business themselves, intruding on the proceedings in the process.

episodes.title: Wild Over You/Go Fly a Kit/Mouse-Warming
episodes.plot: The midget gangster Baby Faced Finster dresses up as a baby to escape the police. To his dismay, he ends up in the hands of Bugs Bunny, who treats him as a baby.

episodes.title: To Itch His Own/Gee Whiz-z-z-z!/Whoa, Be-Gone!
episodes.plot: Wile E. Coyote's chase of the Road Runner has extended into the studio where Bugs is trying to host his television show. Two Road Runner cartoons are thus featured, involving Wile E.'s schemes.

episodes.title: Canary Row/Knights Must Fall/For Scent-imental Reasons
episodes.plot: Desperate to appear on the show as the guest, Daffy dresses as a Hawaiian, a musketeer, and a knight, but his costume is deemed inappropriate by Bugs for each cartoon about to commence.

episodes.title: Long-Haired Hare/Sandy Claws/Mouse Wreckers
episodes.plot: In a musical competition between cartoon features of Bugs at war with an opera singer, Sylvester buffeted by tidal waves in his gastronomic quest for Tweety, and two mice conspiring to induce house cat insanity, Daffy plays the drums.

episodes.title: Bully For Bugs/Tweety's S.O.S./One Froggy Evening
episodes.plot: Daffy disguises himself as Bugs to host the television show, but a sheepdog, on a day free from his work, walks into the studio, hoping to catch the bunny-rabbit (Bugs) that he saw on television on the previous week.

episodes.title: My Bunny Lies Over the Sea/Scaredy Cat/Scent-imental Romeo
episodes.plot: Daffy wants to be host. So, he banishes all others from the stage, including Pepe, Elmer, and Bugs. Still, the cartoons proceed on schedule, with Bugs in Scotland, Porky and Sylvester in a spooky, mouse-infested house.

episodes.title: Bunker Hill Bunny/Each Dawn I Crow/Golden Yeggs
episodes.plot: Tweety is host of an installment containing two psychological thrillers with birds seemingly doomed to death at a specified time. So that the little canary can be safe from Sylvester, Bugs hangs his cage from the stage ceiling.

episodes.title: Which is Witch/Mouse Mazurka/Kit For Cat
episodes.plot: Yosemite Sam wants Bugs' hide. So, gun in hand, he comes to see The Bugs Bunny Show live as a spectator in the studio.

episodes.title: Two's a Crowd/All a Bir-r-r-d/The Hasty Hare
episodes.plot: Bugs introduces Porky Pig as host. Porky is pestered by Charlie Dog, who is looking for a master. Charlie does his all-breeds-in-one routine and complicates Porky's introduction.

episodes.title: What's Up, Doc?/Early to Bet/Pop 'im Pop!
episodes.plot: George P. Dog is introduced by Bugs as the emcee for the show, but Foghorn Leghorn decides that he would be a better emcee and pushes the dog aside.

episodes.title: A-Lad-in His Lamp/Dog Gone South/A Fractured Leghorn
episodes.plot: Sylvester is introduced by Bugs as host, and he is joined on stage by his son, Sylvester Jr., who is underwhelmed at Sylvester's all-too-brief introduction of him.

episodes.title: Ant Pasted/The Fair-Haired Hare/I Gopher You
episodes.plot: Elmer Fudd is host and tries to sing, but he is thwarted when the notes on his sheet music run off of their page and remind him of his July 4 picnic that became a harrowing confrontation.

episodes.title: Rocket Squad/Daffy Dilly/Drip-Along Daffy
episodes.plot: Daffy finally receives recognition. Bugs hosts an all-Daffy Duck tribute, in which Mama Bear performs "I'm Just Wild About Daffy" and the mallard stars in cartoons as a far-future detective.

episodes.title: The Leghorn Blows at Midnight/His Bitter Half/Hot Cross Bunny
episodes.plot: Foghorn Leghorn introduces Miss Prissy, who, Foghorn says, is an old-time actress.

episodes.title: Lovelorn Leghorn/Who's Kitten Who?/The Windblown Hare
episodes.plot: An unseen animator sketches Foghorn Leghorn with Rock Hudson's body and then draws a broom's tail on Foghorn's backside. Foghorn retaliates by lassoing and pummeling the animator- Daffy Duck.

episodes.title: High Diving Hare/Don't Give Up the Sheep/Stooge For a Mouse
episodes.plot: Two lame-brained Mexicali cats, Jose and Miguel, try to host an episode with Yosemite Sam plummeting again and again into a bucket of water, Ralph Wolf being continually stopped from obtaining mutton by the omnipresent Sam Sheepdog.

episodes.title: High Diving Hare/Don't Give Up the Sheep/Stooge For a Mouse
episodes.plot: Bugs demonstrates how to draw an animated cartoon character. He decides to use Daffy Duck as an example and draws Daffy from a dumbbell.

episodes.title: Rabbit of Seville/The Scarlet Pumpernickel/Stop! Look! And Hasten!
episodes.plot: Bugs tries to indulge the audience in a bit of culture, such as in his own rendition of the opera, "The Barber of Seville", in spite of constant interruptions from Elmer Fudd.

episodes.title: Hillbilly Hare/Hippety Hopper/You Were Never Duckier
episodes.plot: Mac and Tosh, the Goofy Gophers, are introduced by Bugs as the host. In the cartoons, Bugs orchestrates a square dance that very much pains two lame-brained men of the Ozark Mountains.

episodes.title: The Turn-Tale Wolf/Paying the Piper/Beanstalk Bunny
episodes.plot: Sylvester is host and tells to his son, Junior, the Looney Tune-style fairy tales of the Big Bad Wolf and the Three Little Pigs- in which hero and villain roles are seemingly reversed.

episodes.title: Big House Bunny/Canned Feud/Home, Tweet Home
episodes.plot: Mac and Tosh, the Goofy Gophers, are again hosts for the show. They spend their time politely arguing over who should introduce the jailed Bugs, house-imprisoned and in-need-of-food Sylvester, and Tweety-in-a-city-park.

episodes.title: Mississippi Hare/Terrier-Stricken/Cheese Chasers
episodes.plot: Yosemite Sam wants to be the show emcee this time around, but Bugs chooses Pepe Le Pew instead, much to Sam's chagrin.

episodes.title: Henhouse Henery/Curtain Razor/Devil May Hare
episodes.plot: Bugs introduces Daffy Duck as this installment's host, but Daffy is backstage being chased by the Tasmanian Devil, who has broken out of a crate.

episodes.title: Hare We Go/The Foghorn Leghorn/Little Red Rodent Hood
episodes.plot: Okay, rabbit. Grab a cloud. This is a stick-up." Gun-toting gangsters Rocky and Mugsy hijack the show. Mugsy escorts Bugs off of the stage, and Rocky introduces the cartoons.
